article_node.title: Why 20% Of U.S. Billionaires Are Enjoying Higher Life Expectancy
article_node.summary: The article highlights that the U.S. billionaire cohort is aging, with 36 over 90 and 150 in their 80s, yet many remain active—Warren Buffett announced his retirement as Berkshire CEO, while George Joseph continues to chair Mercury General at 103, and Rupert Murdoch has stepped down as executive chairman of News Corp. It notes that wealthier individuals often enjoy longer lifespans due to superior healthcare, diet, and exercise, citing examples like David Murdock's plant‑based regimen and Charles Koch's daily workouts. The piece also touches on the broader trend of older billionaires engaging in philanthropy and succession planning, underscoring the demographic shift that may influence market dynamics and corporate governance.
